Careers information for Chinese students

  • Make the most of your time at university in the UK

  • Understand yourself and your dreams and goals

  • Make yourself more employable

Get ahead on your career journey.

Studying in the UK is the start of an amazing journey that will provide you with knowledge, opportunities and experiences, as well the chance to make new friends and explore a different area of the world.

Making the most of your time in the UK is an important part of your experience and one of the best ways you can do this is to get ahead, and get started on your career journey as early as you can.

Why do I need to get ahead and think about my career?

Statistics show that over 70% of Chinese students who have studied in the UK return to China after their studies, so it’s important to think about your future now to help guide it in the direction you want to go.

Postgraduate student

I found out that many job vacancies, internships and work experience opportunities are advertised between September and December, so you need to start applying for these at the beginning of the academic year. Thinking about my career from an early stage really helped me to secure the internship I wanted.

Getting started

Use this website to create your own career plan that you can download at the end of the course and use to develop your skills and employability whilst you are in the UK, and beyond. Your career plan will help make you more employable and help you get ahead in your chosen career. Plus it’s a great way to understand more about yourself and your goals.

Follow the seven steps below to develop your career plan.

Created by the University of Warwick. Funded by the FCO Prosperity Fund.
